cz.ive.location
Class PathFinderImpl

java.lang.Object
  cz.ive.location.PathFinderImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
PathFinder, java.io.Serializable
public class PathFinderImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements PathFinder, java.io.Serializable

General implementation of PathFinder. This class finds the path with no restriction to the topology and to the world's dimense. This class is implemented as a singleton and does not need to be serializable, because when it does not computing, it contains no state data.

Author:
pavel
See Also:
Serialized Form

bag

protected java.util.PriorityQueue<PathFinderImpl.PathPoint> bag
The main structure of the A* algorithm.

targetSet

protected java.util.List<WayPoint> targetSet
The set of target waypoints. This information is needed when comparing two PathPoints, by this variable we avoid storing it in each PathPoint.

pointMap

protected java.util.HashMap<WayPoint,PathFinderImpl.PathPoint> pointMap
The map from WayPoints to PathPoints.

emptyInstance

public static void emptyInstance()
Empty whole the PathFinder before the XML load. We just drop the singleton and create a new one.

protected void cleanStructures()
Cleans data structures to be ready for another search

guessDistance

protected double guessDistance(WayPoint from,
                               WayPoint to)
Guesses the distance of two points. It means, computes the shortest distance between their real coordinates.

Parameters:
from - First WayPoint
to - Second Waypoint
Returns:
the lower guess of their distance

guessDistanceFromSet

protected double guessDistanceFromSet(WayPoint from,
                                      java.util.List<WayPoint> to)
Guesses the distance of a point and a set of points. It computes distance tu each point from the set as described at guessDistance() method, and takes the shortest one.

Parameters:
from - Starting WayPoint
to - Set of target Waypoints
Returns:
the lower guess of their distance

decreaseKeys

protected void decreaseKeys(PathFinderImpl.PathPoint point,
                            Kind kinds,
                            boolean substantial)
Relaxes all joints from the given pathpoint.

Parameters:
point - PathPoint which neighbours' distances will be recomputed
kinds - Kinds of WayPoints that can be used
substantial - avoid occupied WayPoints?

constructPath

protected java.util.List<WayPoint> constructPath(PathFinderImpl.PathPoint from,
                                                 PathFinderImpl.PathPoint to)
Builds the path from the predecessor-list created by the algorithm. The path will start by the first WayPoint after the 'from' WayPoint and finish by the 'to' WayPoint.

Parameters:
from - The starting point of the path.
to - The target point of the path.

findPath

public java.util.List<WayPoint> findPath(WayPoint from,
                                         java.util.List<WayPoint> to,
                                         Kind kinds,
                                         boolean substantial)
Finds path within one Area on the same LOD level. The A* algorithm is used to find the path. However, it is generalized to search for the path to the set of points, not only one. As a heuristic function is used the direct distance between the real coordinates of the points.

Specified by:
findPath in interface PathFinder
Parameters:
from - WayPoint from where we should start the search
to - list of target WayPoints
kinds - kinds of the WayPoints used in the Path
substantial - avoid occupied WayPoints?
Returns:
list of WayPoints on found path or null if there is no possible path within this Area

findPathToNeighbour

public java.util.List<WayPoint> findPathToNeighbour(Area area,
                                                    WayPoint from,
                                                    WayPoint to,
                                                    Kind kinds,
                                                    boolean substantial)
Finds path within one Area to one of its neighbour Areas. See findPath() method for algorithm implementation details.

Specified by:
findPathToNeighbour in interface PathFinder
Parameters:
area - Area where is the starting WayPoint situated
from - WayPoint from where we should start the search
to - WayPoint representing adjacent Area
kinds - kinds of the WayPoints used in the Path
substantial - avoid occupied WayPoints?
Returns:
list of WayPoints on found path or null if there is no possible path within this Area
